commit_message:
Add tests for component registry suite for vCenter

With component registry mechanism plugins can set compatibility,
incompatibility and requires between components.

Current tests implement automatization to verify UI representation of
components relations. They have to be run regularly on CI.

To run tests you need to export variables PLUGIN_RPM (path to
example-plugin rpm) and VENV (path to virtual env). Run with
`npm run component-tests`.

Closes-Bug: #1597710
Change-Id: I5d929da714a4c44515094df4e6edd3a7d93f4aa0

subject: Fix hard drive size miscalculation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8935, 'name': 'Andrey Danin', 'email': 'gcon.monolake@gmail.com', 'username': 'adanin'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 14610, 'name': 'Denis V. Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-09 08:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': 'Fix hard drive size miscalculation

On Linux ohai gets the block device size from /sys/block/$device/size.
That size is always measured in units of 512 bytes even if the "physical"
block size of the device in question is different [1][2]. On the other hand
/sys/block/$device/queue/logical_block_size is the smallest unit which
the device can address, and /sys/block/$device/queue/physical_block_size
is the smallest unit the physical storage device can write atomically.
Typically SATA/SAS drives having the size >= 2 TB have 4 KB physical
sectors and expose 512 "logical" block size to the operating system.
However some hard drives (for instance, HGST Ultrastar 7K6000 SAS drive)
expose the actual physical sector size (that is, 4 KB) for the efficiency
reasons. As a result nailgun-agent miscomputes the size of the hard drive
(it's 8x off!)

[1] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/include/linux/types.h?v=4.4#L124
[2] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/drivers/scsi/sd.c?v=4.4#L2340

Change-Id: Iae36b11dce8e6f43d7ee4bddac5098c633883ed6
Cherry-pick from: 76f48ff6c6a3996a7800a34cd97c5bfd4539107f
Closes-Bug: #1544816
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hard drive size miscalculation

On Linux ohai gets the block device size from /sys/block/$device/size.
That size is always measured in units of 512 bytes even if the "physical"
block size of the device in question is different [1][2]. On the other hand
/sys/block/$device/queue/logical_block_size is the smallest unit which
the device can address, and /sys/block/$device/queue/physical_block_size
is the smallest unit the physical storage device can write atomically.
Typically SATA/SAS drives having the size >= 2 TB have 4 KB physical
sectors and expose 512 "logical" block size to the operating system.
However some hard drives (for instance, HGST Ultrastar 7K6000 SAS drive)
expose the actual physical sector size (that is, 4 KB) for the efficiency
reasons. As a result nailgun-agent miscomputes the size of the hard drive
(it's 8x off!)

[1] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/include/linux/types.h?v=4.4#L124
[2] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/drivers/scsi/sd.c?v=4.4#L2340

Change-Id: Iae36b11dce8e6f43d7ee4bddac5098c633883ed6
Cherry-pick from: 76f48ff6c6a3996a7800a34cd97c5bfd4539107f
Closes-Bug: #1544816

subject: Update trove jobs to include api-ref job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 18:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Update trove jobs to include api-ref job

This change adds the api-ref jobs to the trove template. While getting
this to work, another (latent) problem was also discovered. Since the
restrictions on the gate-trove-tox-doc-publish-checkbuild were limited
to changes to the (non existant) apidocs directory, when a previous
change to tox.ini removed the install_command on the checkbuild job,
it was allowed to merge. Added tox.ini to the trigger to re-run that
job.

This change is dependent on the merging of changes in Trove to
actually create this job, etc.,

Change-Id: Ia28c66d38b7a07bd5e0db7a15f49a28377c29330
Depends-On: I3315261aa18729fa7a6aa79d4a1d6c24de1e2c6b
'}]
commit_message:
Update trove jobs to include api-ref job

This change adds the api-ref jobs to the trove template. While getting
this to work, another (latent) problem was also discovered. Since the
restrictions on the gate-trove-tox-doc-publish-checkbuild were limited
to changes to the (non existant) apidocs directory, when a previous
change to tox.ini removed the install_command on the checkbuild job,
it was allowed to merge. Added tox.ini to the trigger to re-run that
job.

This change is dependent on the merging of changes in Trove to
actually create this job, etc.,

Change-Id: Ia28c66d38b7a07bd5e0db7a15f49a28377c29330
Depends-On: I3315261aa18729fa7a6aa79d4a1d6c24de1e2c6b

commit_message:
Refactors wmi exceptions usage

There are conditional imports (Windows specific modules), 
done in most of os-win's modules. One of the modules is wmi, 
is mostly used in try-except blocks.

Imports wmi.x_wmi and wmi.x_wmi_timed_out exceptions 
into os_win.exceptions. Refactors wmi exceptions usage.

Change-Id: I40107892c63d6186fa3d8bac36e56b28ef8c7910

commit_message:
Adds action for template processing

This patch moves the code that deals with calling out to
heatclient to process multiple files and environments from
utils/templates.py into an action that will provide a base object
for the deployment and parameters actions to inherit from. This
patch also removes the resulting dead code (utils/templates.py)
and its associated test.

Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8efb53ac14c3b952743d1871df8d63d32685b6b1

subject: Pass retry count=1 into keystone session
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9588, 'name': 'Sergey Novikov', 'email': 'snovikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'snovikov'}, {'_account_id': 15984, 'name': 'Vladimir Khlyunev', 'email': 'vkhlyunev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkhlyunev'}, {'_account_id': 16106, 'name': 'Alexandr Kostrikov', 'email': 'akostrikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akostrikov'}, {'_account_id': 19119, 'name': 'Alexey Stepanov', 'email': 'penguinolog@ik.me', 'username': 'penguinolog'}, {'_account_id': 19120, 'name': 'Mikhail Samoylov', 'email': 'msamoylov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'msamoylov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 20:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/nailgun_client.py'], 'message': 'Pass retry count=1 into keystone session

KeystoneAuth can handle connection failure and timeouts not related to
target service but but defauit this retries are disabled. We are faced with
several issues related to broken session in case of changed time on server or
even restart of nailgun. The second request will re-create session inside of
KeystoneAuth so lets allow session to handle it.

Related-bug:1606887
Change-Id: I3011e25a5c81f74015430b5ace5aa14bc4695bb8
'}]
commit_message:
Pass retry count=1 into keystone session

KeystoneAuth can handle connection failure and timeouts not related to
target service but but defauit this retries are disabled. We are faced with
several issues related to broken session in case of changed time on server or
even restart of nailgun. The second request will re-create session inside of
KeystoneAuth so lets allow session to handle it.

Related-bug:1606887
Change-Id: I3011e25a5c81f74015430b5ace5aa14bc4695bb8

commit_message:
Pass retry count=1 into keystone session

KeystoneAuth can handle connection failure and timeouts not related to
target service but but defauit this retries are disabled. We are faced with
several issues related to broken session in case of changed time on server or
even restart of nailgun. The second request will re-create session inside of
KeystoneAuth so lets allow session to handle it.

Related-bug:1606887
Change-Id: I3011e25a5c81f74015430b5ace5aa14bc4695bb8

commit_message:
[DOCS]Edited the path to installation workflow diagram in install-guide-draft

The path to workflow diagram in install-guide-draft mispelled the
name of the diagram due to which the diagram was not getting displayed
on the page.

This patch would resolve the issue.

Change-Id: I30bc83008bd49ca22e3374dbf93185b82c6fe274
Closes-Bug: #1614662

commit_message:
Do not provide endpoint for glance client

Do not provide endpoint for glance client
GlanceClient without endpoint could not start without session
and we using session only
Closes-bug: #1605136

Change-Id: Ie5984b8fb5e5f531d2f22f19bedf2ac0eba0a655
(cherry picked from commit a81ed1ba10ddfcb99a3fd7dedc35f1a5b455aef8)

subject: live-patch libdpkg-perl to ignore .gitreview changes
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-19 10:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['debian/openstack-pkg-tools.install', 'build-tools/pkgos-infra-install-sbuild', 'misc/libdpkg-perl-gitreview.patch'], 'message': 'live-patch libdpkg-perl to ignore .gitreview changes

1/ Calculate NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST variable
2/ Add jessie-newton-backports from that host to apt/sources.list
3/ Fetch repo gpg key
4/ Add it with apt-key
5/ Patch libdpkg-perl to ignore .gitreview files

Change-Id: Iea50b090220130cc8edb6156f11401347883c079
'}]
commit_message:
live-patch libdpkg-perl to ignore .gitreview changes

1/ Calculate NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST variable
2/ Add jessie-newton-backports from that host to apt/sources.list
3/ Fetch repo gpg key
4/ Add it with apt-key
5/ Patch libdpkg-perl to ignore .gitreview files

Change-Id: Iea50b090220130cc8edb6156f11401347883c079

commit_message:
Add key/value support for orchestrating images

When orchestrating images, Heat template authors may want to add
metadata key/value pairs at orchestration time rather than afterward.
This code defines a new form `extra_properties` that, when provided a
dictionary of properties, will apply them to the image.

Co-Authored-By: Andy Hsiang <yh418t@att.com>

Implements blueprint glance-heat-metadata-enhancements

Change-Id: I1728228af839a301b93f741068fdd4b0cce5fc6c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-17 12:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['octane/handlers/backup_restore/puppet.py', 'octane/util/keystone.py', 'octane/magic_consts.py', 'octane/tests/test_archivators_restore.py', 'octane/handlers/backup_restore/postgres.py', 'octane/tests/test_util_keystone.py'], 'message': 'Remove admin_token_auth from keystone pipelines

The presence of the admin_token_auth middleware is needed only to apply
the keystone puppet task during the restore phase. This middleware
allows to authorize with admin_token and configure things in Keystone.
After the successful re-initialization of Keystone this middleware
should be removed from pipelines alongside with restarting the keystone
service because of security reasons.

Change-Id: Id98d8f25270538ab850af936eff749f0277e0c58
'}]
commit_message:
Remove admin_token_auth from keystone pipelines

The presence of the admin_token_auth middleware is needed only to apply
the keystone puppet task during the restore phase. This middleware
allows to authorize with admin_token and configure things in Keystone.
After the successful re-initialization of Keystone this middleware
should be removed from pipelines alongside with restarting the keystone
service because of security reasons.

Change-Id: Id98d8f25270538ab850af936eff749f0277e0c58

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 08:22:21.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/hyperv_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': ' Pass on port_delete RPC call

The port_delete RPC call will now just pass as this is already
handled by our event based mechanism.

The agent will get an event when a VM nic is removed and as a result,
it will unbind the port, thus making the RPC call action redundant.

Change-Id: If5acd88fdd199c004474718ec0f2fadc06674424
'}]
commit_message:
Pass on port_delete RPC call

The port_delete RPC call will now just pass as this is already
handled by our event based mechanism.

The agent will get an event when a VM nic is removed and as a result,
it will unbind the port, thus making the RPC call action redundant.

Change-Id: If5acd88fdd199c004474718ec0f2fadc06674424

commit_message:
deprecate command `cinder endpoints`

The command `cinder endpoints` will now print a warning message,
indicating that users should use openstackclient instead.
This has already been done in nova's CLI [1].

Related-Bug: 1608166

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L4071-L4072

Change-Id: If68b40cf8116aa0ec386d8067c58703cb7b7c0da

commit_message:
Do not provide endpoint for glance client

Do not provide endpoint for glance client
GlanceClient without endpoint could not start without session
and we using session only
Closes-bug: #1605136

commit_message:
Make nova-consoleauth use memcache as cache backend

Now Mirantis OpenStack uses python dictionary's to store
nova-consoleauth tokens and it fails to connect to VNC on
page reload if we use HA cluster, so we need to use
memcache as cache backend.

Change-Id: I7da25b331f5665ec1b82544f476aebefdfa6113d
Closes-Bug: #1576218

subject: Created HTTP wrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-18 20:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['src/keystone.js', 'test/unit/keystoneTest.js', 'test/unit/util/httpTest.js', 'src/util/http.js'], 'message': 'Created HTTP wrapper

This utility class provides an abstraction layer for HTTP calls via fetch(). Its purpose is
to provide common, SDK-wide behavior for all HTTP requests. Included are:

- Providing a common extension point for request and response manipulation.
- Access to default headers.

In the future, this class chould also be extended to provide:

- Some form of progress() support for large uploads and downloads (perhaps via introduction of Q)
- Convenience decoding of the response body, depending on Content-Type.
- Internal error handling (At this time, HTTP errors are passed to then() rather than catch()).
- Other features.

Change-Id: I8173554b1b7ef052e2a74504b98f4ec574ce6136
'}]
commit_message:
Created HTTP wrapper

This utility class provides an abstraction layer for HTTP calls via fetch(). Its purpose is
to provide common, SDK-wide behavior for all HTTP requests. Included are:

- Providing a common extension point for request and response manipulation.
- Access to default headers.

In the future, this class chould also be extended to provide:

- Some form of progress() support for large uploads and downloads (perhaps via introduction of Q)
- Convenience decoding of the response body, depending on Content-Type.
- Internal error handling (At this time, HTTP errors are passed to then() rather than catch()).
- Other features.

Change-Id: I8173554b1b7ef052e2a74504b98f4ec574ce6136

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-16 11:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/110_postgresql_upgrade.sql', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/109_POC_add_new_user_table.py', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo_contract/versions/002_postgresql_upgrade.sql', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/110_mysql_upgrade.sql', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/110_sqlite_upgrade.sql', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo_contract/versions/002_drop_user_table.py'], 'message': 'POC of data migration using database triggers

THIS PATCH SHOULD NEVER BE MERGED AND SHOULD NOT BE
CONSIDERED PART OF THE PREVIOUS PATCHES.

Simple example of how we might use triggers to allow RW during
rolling upgrades. For this example, we have pretended that we
are going to create a new user table, and want to migrate the
data to it.

So far, the following has been implemented:

- Create the new table in the --expand cycle
- Triggers on insert, so that a new user written to either
  table gets reflected back
- Tests that show this is working
- Drop the triggers on --contract

To add:
- The actual migration code of --migrate (although that is not
  inovative in terms of this POC)
- Triggers for Update and Delete operations.

Change-Id: Ia488fb1c46d3ff2a6981c1389b67c8f436418d77
'}]
commit_message:
POC of data migration using database triggers

THIS PATCH SHOULD NEVER BE MERGED AND SHOULD NOT BE
CONSIDERED PART OF THE PREVIOUS PATCHES.

Simple example of how we might use triggers to allow RW during
rolling upgrades. For this example, we have pretended that we
are going to create a new user table, and want to migrate the
data to it.

So far, the following has been implemented:

- Create the new table in the --expand cycle
- Triggers on insert, so that a new user written to either
  table gets reflected back
- Tests that show this is working
- Drop the triggers on --contract

To add:
- The actual migration code of --migrate (although that is not
  inovative in terms of this POC)
- Triggers for Update and Delete operations.

Change-Id: Ia488fb1c46d3ff2a6981c1389b67c8f436418d77

subject: Conditionally run gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge in nova check
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-11 21:34:38.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Conditionally run gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge in nova check

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge is gating for neutron which
means nova can merge something to break it and block neutron from
landing any code. In an effort to ease into gating nova changes
on gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge we start with only running
it on changes to nova/network/* files. We can increase the exposure
as necessary with the ultimate goal to be fully gating when we
start dropping nova-network-backed jobs.

This is intentionally only the check queue for now since we (a) think
the risk exposure for a co-gating failure is low and (b) we want to
avoid hammering the CI system with more jobs if we can help it.

Change-Id: I21af439a90104960bcb1cfbcb8afeb909f96a2ad
Related-Bug: #1612281
'}]
commit_message:
Conditionally run gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge in nova check

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge is gating for neutron which
means nova can merge something to break it and block neutron from
landing any code. In an effort to ease into gating nova changes
on gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge we start with only running
it on changes to nova/network/* files. We can increase the exposure
as necessary with the ultimate goal to be fully gating when we
start dropping nova-network-backed jobs.

This is intentionally only the check queue for now since we (a) think
the risk exposure for a co-gating failure is low and (b) we want to
avoid hammering the CI system with more jobs if we can help it.

Change-Id: I21af439a90104960bcb1cfbcb8afeb909f96a2ad
Related-Bug: #1612281

commit_message:
Fix some requirements and installation instruction

- Add coverage to test-requirements which was causing import error when
  running `make test`
- Add "make" to bindep.txt for rpm package
- Add "python-dev/python-devel" to bindep.txt
- Add some instration guide example, how to install those dependency
  packages

Change-Id: Ib4a19e734e68ac4d3be7ea13dc72a97b4e209b2b

commit_message:
api-ref doc for stack (3)

Fix docs for stack-find, stack-show, stack-list APIs.
Major changes include:

- Revise stack query parameters to differentiate them from stack
  object body fields.
- Added 'resolve_outputs' to stack-find interface.
- Added response sample and documentation for stack-find API.
  We should faithfully document the 302 status code and body.
- Added missing parameter 'stacks' for stack-list call.
- Added missing 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' parameter in responses.

Change-Id: Ifc4937a254ff766ae83c80c009047d926eebf72f

subject: Rework engine scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 07:09:27.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/dispatcher.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_cluster_policies.py', 'senlin/engine/scheduler.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_webhooks.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_nodes.py', 'senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/engine/actions/cluster_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_cluster_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'Rework engine scheduler

This patch reworks engine scheduler to make it to work in "tickless"
way. The following changes were made:

 - Start_action method of scheduler is changed, it now always tries
   to acquire and schedule all actions in ready status;
 - Revise all existing calls for dispatcher.start_action in both
   service and cluster_action module: start_action rpc call is now
   being invoked without specifying action_id;
 - Notify scheduler only once after all node_create sub actions
   depdended by parent cluster_create action are ready since scheduler
   will try to schedule all of them automatically now.
 - Revise dispatcher.notify method to 1) broadcast start_action rpc
   call correctly, 2) use 'cast' rather than 'call' method to avoid
   blocking engine service for waiting for dispatcher's rpc response;
 - Use with_for_update to avoid race condition happens during action
   acquiring. Looks like current implementation of action_acquire db
   api can't avoid multiple engines locking the same action after
   they receive the start_action broadcast.

Change-Id: I5f6804b0ceb2341dcf2fa16c0f7d42972b7d6ae1
(cherry picked from commit 3db0a3e8cd65ef274f0c387bcb5a8550fbd4f60f)
'}]
commit_message:
Rework engine scheduler

This patch reworks engine scheduler to make it to work in "tickless"
way. The following changes were made:

 - Start_action method of scheduler is changed, it now always tries
   to acquire and schedule all actions in ready status;
 - Revise all existing calls for dispatcher.start_action in both
   service and cluster_action module: start_action rpc call is now
   being invoked without specifying action_id;
 - Notify scheduler only once after all node_create sub actions
   depdended by parent cluster_create action are ready since scheduler
   will try to schedule all of them automatically now.
 - Revise dispatcher.notify method to 1) broadcast start_action rpc
   call correctly, 2) use 'cast' rather than 'call' method to avoid
   blocking engine service for waiting for dispatcher's rpc response;
 - Use with_for_update to avoid race condition happens during action
   acquiring. Looks like current implementation of action_acquire db
   api can't avoid multiple engines locking the same action after
   they receive the start_action broadcast.

Change-Id: I5f6804b0ceb2341dcf2fa16c0f7d42972b7d6ae1
(cherry picked from commit 3db0a3e8cd65ef274f0c387bcb5a8550fbd4f60f)

This patch continues the fix to the api-ref doc for stack resource. To
ensure upcoming patches are not messing up the parameter defintions,
this patch is cleansing up the parameters that appear both in URLs and
request/response bodies: 'stack_id', 'stack_name', 'resource_name',
'event_id', 'snapshot_id', etc. These parameters sometimes are playing
different roles although the name is the same.
Other fixes included in this patch:

- added back the stack-outputs and stack-snapshots into index
- split resource-types out of stack-templates and add reference to it
  into index (git misunderstood this as a renaming, :))

Change-Id: I2b486a9b85d23d3225a5701c2265ecea2f4712f7
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref doc for stack (2)

This patch continues the fix to the api-ref doc for stack resource. To
ensure upcoming patches are not messing up the parameter defintions,
this patch is cleansing up the parameters that appear both in URLs and
request/response bodies: 'stack_id', 'stack_name', 'resource_name',
'event_id', 'snapshot_id', etc. These parameters sometimes are playing
different roles although the name is the same.
Other fixes included in this patch:

- added back the stack-outputs and stack-snapshots into index
- split resource-types out of stack-templates and add reference to it
  into index (git misunderstood this as a renaming, :))

Change-Id: I2b486a9b85d23d3225a5701c2265ecea2f4712f7

commit_message:
api-ref doc for stack (1)

This patch, as a first step, fixes inaccuracies/bugs in api-ref
documentation for stacks. The major changes in this patch include:

- Added missing 'location' and 'X-OpenStack-Request-Id' parameters
  which both appear in some response headers.
- Deleted some descriptions about parameters that are never
  referenced in any APIs.
- Added missing 'deletion_time' parameter.
- Added missing 'environment_files' parameter.
- Added missing sample JSON file for stack-create-response.json.
- Fixed errors in stack-preview-response.json.
- Added tabular description of response codes.
- Added a status.yaml file for response code description (shared).

Change-Id: I826ed899f925812df9b44144469700453789e087

This patch splits the stacks.inc file into three files so that we can
patch them separately. The original file contains API calls about
stacks, stack snapshots and stack outputs, however, the latter two
have every right to be documented separately.

commit_message:
Relax bound constraint for trunk parent ports

This patch revisits the is_bound() condition for ports that
are about to be used as parent in a trunk. The existing
logic checked that for a port to be bound it is either an
unbound compute port or it is associated to a host. In pratice
only the latter suffices.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I1c2c877b5cc421e05d97c7f528546a6a2c14aa46

commit_message:
Fix key word argument interface_type -> interface

When calling session.get_endpoint, the key word argument to specify the
interface type (public, admin, internal), is "interface", not
"interface_type".  This was causing the public endpoint to be returned
instead of the internal endpoint.

Change-Id: I77f697e74769cd622fb30f6b065e8645ba5cc39f
Closes-Bug: #1613331

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 19:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py'], 'message': 'Use default value for undefined caps in fmt_caps

Currently test suite fails if executed from Docker container because

commit_message:
Use default value for undefined caps in fmt_caps

Currently test suite fails if executed from Docker container because
process has capabilities that are not defined in
CAPS_BYVALUE. Alternative is to define symbolic name for all
capabilities.

Change-Id: Ieb1ea2ab45d76fc838c11489c2b029d7a5295e0e

commit_message:
Upper constraints is supported for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. This patch removes install_command for
upper constraints from all post jobs.

Change-Id: Ic173e442db3ecbaee73b6dc328082b51ab502ff4
Closes-Bug: #1614117

commit_message:
Always set DEFAULT/host in devstack.

This patch always set DEFAULT/host option to local machine hostname.
When mutinode setup is used conductors should have different host values.

Change-Id: I54056d163c06f0afb3702c3af98d85342c6e8232

commit_message:
Fix nova exchange exception

Currently, searchlight listener is failing to get notifications for
nova flavors, this is because it fails to retrieve notification
topics and exchanges from search plugin, os_nova_flavor.
This patch fixes the error.

Change-Id: I56a0b627511922ecafaf881b424e9d592f5c8211
closes-bug: #1607842

commit_message:
Improve doc for using container-sync with large objects

Clarify that synced segment container names must be the same
when syncing large objects.

Also add multipart-menifest query string option to API ref
for object GETs.

Change-Id: Ib2d2a1e6c1e5eff215fc75c2b49e7d6758b17b7e
Partial-Bug: #1613681
Closes-Bug: #1613316

subject: Use more specific asserts in test/unit/proxy tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:32:33.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_account.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_info.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_sysmeta.py'], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in test/unit/proxy tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type)
or assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: If6aad8681aab7c9a41d65a4f449d8abbe3e64616
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/proxy tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type)
or assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: If6aad8681aab7c9a41d65a4f449d8abbe3e64616

subject: change repo url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 09:54:47.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': 'change repo url

http://ceph.com/debian-hammer redirects to
http://download.ceph.com/debian-hammer/
However while setting: CEPH_RELEASE=jewel http://ceph.com/debian-jewel
does not redirect to http://download.ceph.com/debian-jewel and stack
fails. So fixing the repo url by directly using
http://download.ceph.com

Change-Id: Ib8e80e43674c6d8ffd01bc6af56e66e9e254213b
Signed-off-by: S√©bastien Han <seb@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
change repo url

http://ceph.com/debian-hammer redirects to
http://download.ceph.com/debian-hammer/
However while setting: CEPH_RELEASE=jewel http://ceph.com/debian-jewel
does not redirect to http://download.ceph.com/debian-jewel and stack
fails. So fixing the repo url by directly using
http://download.ceph.com

Change-Id: Ib8e80e43674c6d8ffd01bc6af56e66e9e254213b
Signed-off-by: S√©bastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 18:53:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/api.py'], 'message': "Fix consistency in API conf

Despite having all header flags removed API conf still contained
inconsistency in a form of misplaced asterisk.

Furthermore, because of how doc generation works, the real line length limit
is not 79, but 77 - docs append '# ' at the beginning of every help
message - thus adding additonal line break and a new line with single word.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Iacfe0a2ed94e735a06a7e22ecc2b20dcd0903b74
"}]
commit_message:
Fix consistency in API conf

Despite having all header flags removed API conf still contained
inconsistency in a form of misplaced asterisk.

Furthermore, because of how doc generation works, the real line length limit
is not 79, but 77 - docs append '# ' at the beginning of every help
message - thus adding additonal line break and a new line with single word.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

RecycleSecondaryVolume should be the same as DeleteSecondaryVolume.

Added additional debug logging of async failures.

commit_message:
Persist Searchlight user settings via localstorage

This path persists Searchlight user settings via localstorage.  It only
stores the settings that are explicitly selectable by the user, and it
overlays the inline default settings.

Change-Id: I97628867362a6b8961018fea559d4da0bfcda4f6
Closes-Bug: 1614729

commit_message:
Service policy file support

Adds support for configuring policy files for e.g. compute, image
etc. Each resource type defines a policy action it will look for.

Simplifies the existing searchlight policy.json to remove the
resource:operation rules in favor of allowing or disallowing access
to a resource for all operations. This patch also changes the default
rules for searchlight to admin_or_owner type rules which is more similar
to other services, and improves the plumbing to allow those kinds of
rules to work.

Change-Id: Ic705ee6ba864b646802c01a27e78a92db7273897
Implements: blueprint support-service-policy-files

commit_message:
Store api_version object in one place

Currently we store api_version in two places: client and
HTTPClient/SessionClient instances.

It would be nice to store it in one place, so it would be easier
to change api_version without recreating novaclient object.

Change-Id: I36369a126c20de5922141e8725834ca93d6b0a1a

Change-Id: Ia5be0e96fff1a4ddd6058d6b030ddf96da4b46e7

commit_message:
Re-work static_settings to clean up

This patch reduces duplication arbitrary directory choices for
xstatic package locations in the static directory.

It moves the xstatic configuration from the library into the
settings file, and the supporting functions move to
the openstack_dashboard.utils.settings module. Having the xstatic
module list in settings allows deployers to add new modules.

It standardises the paths the files are served from, reducing
potential conflicts.

It simplifies the interaction with the xstatic modules, and also uses
the new MAIN variable if present to determine the entry points used.

Since some of the xstatic packages were installed into special
snowflakes directories (not following a pattern) the references to
those (bootstrap_scss and font_awesome) have been fixed.

Change-Id: Ia5be0e96fff1a4ddd6058d6b030ddf96da4b46e7

When create a service with region = None,

in <lambda>

The problem code:

    sorted(request.user.available_services_regions,
           key=lambda x: x.lower())

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in context_selection.py

When create a service with region = None,

File "/openstack_dashboard/templatetags/context_selection.py", line 100,
in <lambda>
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'lower'

The problem code:

    sorted(request.user.available_services_regions,
           key=lambda x: x.lower())

To fix this, if region is NoneType, use '' as key to put it first in the
list.

Change-Id: Ide8eaeeee634bf1933ef263d3b27204c7711d167
Closes-Bug: #1581667

commit_message:
Removed inline_edit functionality for tables

As per agreed in Austin summit and then confirmed in the midcycle,
the inline_edit form/functionality is more an issue than a solution.
It leads to many bugs and UX is not the best.

Implements: blueprint remove-table-inline-edit
Change-Id: I91394e4a63afadb66659b6b7c04cb7f8da948ff8

commit_message:
Mark searchlight ES-1 test job non-voting

The python-elasticsearch 2.4.0 release broke the
gate-searchlight-python27-searchlight-es1 job. We're not sure yet
whether or not to keep the job longer term, but I'm marking it
non-voting in the meantime to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I4d9901f5efd47b714762bb167332b3e496f30dc2
Partial-bug: #1614275

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 07:04:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/assignment/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/assignment/test_core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_credential.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_kvs.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap_pool.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/catalog/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_templated.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/contrib/federation/test_utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_ldap_pool_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/assignment/role_backends/test_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/policy/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_associate_project_endpoint_extension.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': "Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, we have:

    def assertEqual(self, first, second, msg=None):

and:

    def __init__(self, methodName='runTest'):
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(dict, 'assertDictEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(list, 'assertListEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(tuple, 'assertTupleEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(set, 'assertSetEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(frozenset, 'assertSetEqual')

and assertDictEqual() uses != to do the comparation:

    def assertDictEqual(self, d1, d2, msg=None):
        self.assertIsInstance(d1, dict, 'First argument is not a dictionary')
        self.assertIsInstance(d2, dict, 'Second argument is not a dictionary')

        if d1 != d2:
            standardMsg = '%s != %s' % _common_shorten_repr(d1, d2)
            diff = ('\n' + '\n'.join(difflib.ndiff(
                           pprint.pformat(d1).splitlines(),
                           pprint.pformat(d2).splitlines())))
            standardMsg = self._truncateMessage(standardMsg, diff)
            self.fail(self._formatMessage(msg, standardMsg))

So assertEqual() in unittest2 is able to handle dicts.

Furthermore, most unit tests use testtools, which is based on
unittest2. In testtools, we have:

    def assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message=''):
        matcher = _FlippedEquals(expected)
        self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)

and:

    class Equals(_BinaryComparison):
        comparator = operator.eq
        mismatch_string = '!='

That means, testtools also uses != to do the comparation.
So it is able to handle the dicts too.

So we can simply use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual().
This will unify the unit test code, and will also simplify the
development of unit tests.

Change-Id: Ifdf2b89555f41a2cb069a7d7048e5a284f460713
"}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, we have:

    def assertEqual(self, first, second, msg=None):
        assertion_func = self._getAssertEqualityFunc(first, second)
        assertion_func(first, second, msg=msg)

and:

    def __init__(self, methodName='runTest'):
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(dict, 'assertDictEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(list, 'assertListEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(tuple, 'assertTupleEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(set, 'assertSetEqual')
        self.addTypeEqualityFunc(frozenset, 'assertSetEqual')

and assertDictEqual() uses != to do the comparation:

    def assertDictEqual(self, d1, d2, msg=None):
        self.assertIsInstance(d1, dict, 'First argument is not a dictionary')
        self.assertIsInstance(d2, dict, 'Second argument is not a dictionary')

        if d1 != d2:
            standardMsg = '%s != %s' % _common_shorten_repr(d1, d2)
            diff = ('\n' + '\n'.join(difflib.ndiff(
                           pprint.pformat(d1).splitlines(),
                           pprint.pformat(d2).splitlines())))
            standardMsg = self._truncateMessage(standardMsg, diff)
            self.fail(self._formatMessage(msg, standardMsg))

So assertEqual() in unittest2 is able to handle dicts.

Furthermore, most unit tests use testtools, which is based on
unittest2. In testtools, we have:

    def assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message=''):
        matcher = _FlippedEquals(expected)
        self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)

and:

    class Equals(_BinaryComparison):
        comparator = operator.eq
        mismatch_string = '!='

That means, testtools also uses != to do the comparation.
So it is able to handle the dicts too.

So we can simply use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual().
This will unify the unit test code, and will also simplify the
development of unit tests.

Change-Id: Ifdf2b89555f41a2cb069a7d7048e5a284f460713

commit_message:
Fix errors in volume set/unset image properties unit tests

These errors may caused by copy-paste, we should specify
a fake return value for get() method but not create() method.
Create() mothod will not called in set/unset command. After
specifing the return value of get(), we can use the fake volume
in the assert.

Change-Id: I1e0df4c28ece373168788c396e9082d565e36cc7

commit_message:
Correction 'extensions' parameter type on Networking API v2.0

The type of 'extensions' parameter in Network list extensions API:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#list-extensions
should be 'array', not 'object'.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-13 03:43:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py'], 'message': "Fix potential problem in test_router_add_interface_port

test_router_add_interface_port may fail when an internal metadata
network is created during add_router_interface action.

The potential problem is introduced by Commit 6281fddbcb4c
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285048/)
which adds an additional update_port inside add_router_interface()
to update device_id and device_owner on the newly created router port.

The problem could happen when users attach a subnet (for example
10.0.0.0/24) to a router. During the add_router_interface action,
vendor's plugin may create an internal metadata subnet (such as
169.254.169.252/30) and attach it to the same router. Since two
router ports (10.0.0.1 and 169.254.169.253) are created during this
operation, the extra update_port was called on both router ports.

Before Commit 6281fddbcb4c, test_router_add_interface_port only saw
one update_port call on 10.0.0.1. After the change, it now sees three
update_port calls, two on 10.0.0.1 and one on 169.254.169.253.
Because it doesn't expect to see the update_port call on port
169.254.169.253 (which is the last update_port call),
the update_port.assert_called_with() fails.

This patch changes the assert method, so it will check if update_port
has been called on the main router port instead of checking the latest
update_port call is on the main router port.

Change-Id: I0ec1c90ee18bd9d0b027ad462cd6a3c6a079347f
Closes-Bug: #1612896
"}]
commit_message:
Fix potential problem in test_router_add_interface_port

test_router_add_interface_port may fail when an internal metadata
network is created during add_router_interface action.

The potential problem is introduced by Commit 6281fddbcb4c
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285048/)
which adds an additional update_port inside add_router_interface()
to update device_id and device_owner on the newly created router port.

The problem could happen when users attach a subnet (for example
10.0.0.0/24) to a router. During the add_router_interface action,
vendor's plugin may create an internal metadata subnet (such as
169.254.169.252/30) and attach it to the same router. Since two
router ports (10.0.0.1 and 169.254.169.253) are created during this
operation, the extra update_port was called on both router ports.

Before Commit 6281fddbcb4c, test_router_add_interface_port only saw
one update_port call on 10.0.0.1. After the change, it now sees three
update_port calls, two on 10.0.0.1 and one on 169.254.169.253.
Because it doesn't expect to see the update_port call on port
169.254.169.253 (which is the last update_port call),
the update_port.assert_called_with() fails.

This patch changes the assert method, so it will check if update_port
has been called on the main router port instead of checking the latest
update_port call is on the main router port.

Change-Id: I0ec1c90ee18bd9d0b027ad462cd6a3c6a079347f
Closes-Bug: #1612896

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-13 03:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_router_add_interface_delete_port_after_failure

In test_router_add_interface_delete_port_after_failure,
when a subnet is created, a neutron DHCP port could be created
if this subnet is DHCP-enabled.

In this case, the test will fail because it only checks if a
router-interface port is deleted and expects no more port in
the system. But it misses the internal DHCP port is still there.

The patch here is to explicitly set enable_dhcp=False when
creating the subnet.

Change-Id: I4acbf2c83f9145f7b99519ec90934fa862de67f7
Closes-Bug: #1612894
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_router_add_interface_delete_port_after_failure

In test_router_add_interface_delete_port_after_failure,
when a subnet is created, a neutron DHCP port could be created
if this subnet is DHCP-enabled.

In this case, the test will fail because it only checks if a
router-interface port is deleted and expects no more port in
the system. But it misses the internal DHCP port is still there.

The patch here is to explicitly set enable_dhcp=False when
creating the subnet.

Change-Id: I4acbf2c83f9145f7b99519ec90934fa862de67f7
Closes-Bug: #1612894

commit_message:
Allow changing lock purpose on lock upgrade

There may be a reason to change the 'purpose' of a lock,
for example performing a non-async deployment task on heartbeat
made through the new heartbeat API.
Allow changing the lock purpose on lock upgrade to have better logging.

Change-Id: Ife86e2b0dc74eaac7163000ea89cdb80a6cd3e87

subject: DevStack: No need to change the ramdisk filesystem type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 09:30:52.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "DevStack: No need to change the ramdisk filesystem type

This patch is removing the conditional that was changing the ramdisk
fileystem type from tmpfs to ramfs in case the amount of RAM was lower
than 1GB.

That code was used before to make the bash ramdisk to boot on machines
with less than 1GB of ram, now we do have TinyIPA so I believe this code
is not needed any more.

Ramfs is old and should be replaced with tmpfs which overcomes many of
it's limitation.

Change-Id: I54fd06213e003aba705118ea0cff72f889cfcc08
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: No need to change the ramdisk filesystem type

This patch is removing the conditional that was changing the ramdisk
fileystem type from tmpfs to ramfs in case the amount of RAM was lower
than 1GB.

That code was used before to make the bash ramdisk to boot on machines
with less than 1GB of ram, now we do have TinyIPA so I believe this code
is not needed any more.

Ramfs is old and should be replaced with tmpfs which overcomes many of
it's limitation.

Change-Id: I54fd06213e003aba705118ea0cff72f889cfcc08

subject: Remove OSIC from 2-node label types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 22:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove OSIC from 2-node label types

Currently in OSIC nodepool/shade write out the public IPv6 addrs to the
private addr info files in /etc/nodepool. This is problematic because we
can't run our OVS + VXLAN tunnels over IPv6 (yay networking). Avoid
problems with multinode testing that relies on OVS + VXLAN over the
"private" addrs by removing OSIC from the 2-node labels.

There is work in progress to fix this behavior in nodepool/shade so that
the private info files use the correct IPv4 addresses which we can run
tunnels over no problem.

Change-Id: Ib1eae2f8d254de191d1b687491a3939c2ff273e6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove OSIC from 2-node label types

Currently in OSIC nodepool/shade write out the public IPv6 addrs to the
private addr info files in /etc/nodepool. This is problematic because we
can't run our OVS + VXLAN tunnels over IPv6 (yay networking). Avoid
problems with multinode testing that relies on OVS + VXLAN over the
"private" addrs by removing OSIC from the 2-node labels.

There is work in progress to fix this behavior in nodepool/shade so that
the private info files use the correct IPv4 addresses which we can run
tunnels over no problem.

Change-Id: Ib1eae2f8d254de191d1b687491a3939c2ff273e6

subject: Enforce limit of VLAN clean ups in each pass
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 9572, 'name': 'Eric Larese', 'email': 'erlarese@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'erlarese'}, {'_account_id': 12947, 'name': 'Sridhar Venkat', 'email': 'svenkat@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'svenkat'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16710, 'name': 'Eric Berglund', 'email': 'esberglu@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'esberglu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-18 16:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sea_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sea_agent.py'], 'message': 'Enforce limit of VLAN clean ups in each pass

If the system has an excessive amount of VLANs to clean up, the heal and
optimization path can block the requests coming in for an extensive
period of time.  This may eventually lead to VIF plugging timeouts on
the nova component.

This change set will stop doing deletes of VLANs after three passes.  It
logs the remaining VLANs that need to be cleaned up, but does not
actually execute the delete.  It assumes the next pass through will do
the appropriate cleanup.

Change-Id: I97d74531b542177b105ca2625949075b1c8fbf24
Closes-Bug: #1612047
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce limit of VLAN clean ups in each pass

If the system has an excessive amount of VLANs to clean up, the heal and
optimization path can block the requests coming in for an extensive
period of time.  This may eventually lead to VIF plugging timeouts on
the nova component.

This change set will stop doing deletes of VLANs after three passes.  It
logs the remaining VLANs that need to be cleaned up, but does not
actually execute the delete.  It assumes the next pass through will do
the appropriate cleanup.

Change-Id: I97d74531b542177b105ca2625949075b1c8fbf24
Closes-Bug: #1612047

subject: Add test for POST to DLO manifest file
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-18 14:32:06.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/tests.py'], 'message': 'Add test for POST to DLO manifest file

In the past, a POST to a DLO manifest file when object_post_as_copy
was true resulted in the manifest file contents being replaced
by the concatenation of the DLO segments.  This no longer
happens, but tests for this case are missing.

This patch adds a functional test to assert that the manifest
file is preserved in a POST request.

Change-Id: I90546014a7dcc7266f0d0e0ff6339688b7954b96
Related-bug: #1487791
Related-bug: #1514317
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for POST to DLO manifest file

In the past, a POST to a DLO manifest file when object_post_as_copy
was true resulted in the manifest file contents being replaced
by the concatenation of the DLO segments.  This no longer
happens, but tests for this case are missing.

This patch adds a functional test to assert that the manifest
file is preserved in a POST request.

Change-Id: I90546014a7dcc7266f0d0e0ff6339688b7954b96
Related-bug: #1487791
Related-bug: #1514317

subject: Removes a redundant test from FernetAuthWithTrust
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 16:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Removes a redundant test from FernetAuthWithTrust

It turns out that the behaviour tests by
test_trust_get_token_fails_if_trustee_disabled is not actually different
between Fernet and UUID if the tokens are properly revoked. The original
test didn't ensure that any time had passed between creating and revoking
a token. This adds a new test showing the different behaviour and modifies
the existing test to works.

Previously this test would fail intermittently when hitting a second
boundary.

If the creation and revocation happen in the same second then Fernet will
indeed respond with a Forbidden. If the revocation happens at least one
second after it will response with the expected Unauthorized.

Change-Id: I31e55e92cd745c34254e96491f97112ff0513baf
"}]
commit_message:
Removes a redundant test from FernetAuthWithTrust

It turns out that the behaviour tests by
test_trust_get_token_fails_if_trustee_disabled is not actually different
between Fernet and UUID if the tokens are properly revoked. The original
test didn't ensure that any time had passed between creating and revoking
a token. This adds a new test showing the different behaviour and modifies
the existing test to works.

Previously this test would fail intermittently when hitting a second
boundary.

If the creation and revocation happen in the same second then Fernet will
indeed respond with a Forbidden. If the revocation happens at least one
second after it will response with the expected Unauthorized.

Change-Id: I31e55e92cd745c34254e96491f97112ff0513baf

subject: Add SNI support via OS packages for os_swift
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-18 18:47:40.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Add SNI support via OS packages for os_swift

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I64c01a75dfdad9850b797013d4f4c7378107e709
'}]
commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages for os_swift

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I64c01a75dfdad9850b797013d4f4c7378107e709

subject: Add shell integration test
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-18 16:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell_integ.py'], 'message': 'Add shell integration test

These run next to unit tests, but unlike unit tests, they test the
dependent libraries also.  This is to detect incompatible breakage
in those dependencies.  The tests provide CLI-level input and
verify the API calls being made via requests using requests_mock
so the entire stack is tested.

It is possible we want to run these separate from the unit tests.
They do not belong in the functional tests as they do not require
a functional cloud for testing.

Depends-on: I426548376fc7d3cdb36501310dafd8c44d22ae30
Change-Id: I356956fcc4ff35191a6ad6a085b75cf370434b09
'}]
commit_message:
Add shell integration test

These run next to unit tests, but unlike unit tests, they test the
dependent libraries also.  This is to detect incompatible breakage
in those dependencies.  The tests provide CLI-level input and
verify the API calls being made via requests using requests_mock
so the entire stack is tested.

It is possible we want to run these separate from the unit tests.
They do not belong in the functional tests as they do not require
a functional cloud for testing.

Depends-on: I426548376fc7d3cdb36501310dafd8c44d22ae30
Change-Id: I356956fcc4ff35191a6ad6a085b75cf370434b09

commit_message:
document locale and language support tips

We have full support for various locales and languages, but often
there are hiccups when setting up a terminal to use OSC in this
manner. Document a few common questions so we don't have to
individually support each bug report.

Change-Id: I0f7c7efce3a2c00cc82ed8c67310e027b5e45a45

commit_message:
Update unique constraint of hosts table

In 'hosts' table hostname should be unique irrespective of
failover_segments. So updated the unique constraint from
"failover_segment, name, deleted" to "name, deleted".

Closes-Bug: #1614081

Change-Id: I6b11a8e4bb5751c9ff5ec600185222ba55b67a2a

subject: Enforce doc8, make it pass, + fix inaccuracies
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-18 16:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'ironic_lib/disk_utils.py', 'tox.ini', 'ironic_lib/metrics.py'], 'message': "Enforce doc8, make it pass, + fix inaccuracies

This patch fixes all sphinx warnings generated by malformed docstrings.

Additionally, it contains formatting and accuracy fixes for the metrics
docstrings, to ensure blockquotes are properly rendered, and to indicate
the get_metrics_logger() method is actually in metrics_utils.

Finally, this adds doc8 to the pep8 job, ensuring we don't reintroduce
some of these errors. As a note, there are items that can cause warnings
in doc builds that aren't enforced by doc8, and can't be enforced until
a doc build job is added to project-config.

Change-Id: I622812bfe8af576ab215c098dd211c6faf697a0c
Partial-bug: #1614272
Partial-bug: #1611559
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce doc8, make it pass, + fix inaccuracies

This patch fixes all sphinx warnings generated by malformed docstrings.

Additionally, it contains formatting and accuracy fixes for the metrics
docstrings, to ensure blockquotes are properly rendered, and to indicate
the get_metrics_logger() method is actually in metrics_utils.

Finally, this adds doc8 to the pep8 job, ensuring we don't reintroduce
some of these errors. As a note, there are items that can cause warnings
in doc builds that aren't enforced by doc8, and can't be enforced until
a doc build job is added to project-config.

Change-Id: I622812bfe8af576ab215c098dd211c6faf697a0c
Partial-bug: #1614272
Partial-bug: #1611559

commit_message:
Add RPC layer for Trunk Plugin and driver plumbing

This patch introduces the RPC backbone required for the trunk plugin to work
with agent-based L2 drivers (like Open vSwitch); to this aim it uses the RPC
callback registry to send/receive trunk and subports OVOs over the wire.

More patches will follow up to complete the RPC integration; some stuff is
still work in progress, but there is enough substance that make this
patch worth it.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adolfo Duarte <adolfo.duarte@hpe.com>
Change-Id: I3c749e9287cc778e12d3e022ddfd157ac9c1569b

commit_message:
objects.qos.policy: provide rules field, not type specific

It should be forbidden to have multiple rules of the same type attached
to a policy, so the idea of having per type lists is moot.

Instead, we should have a single list of all rules that belong to the
policy.

Also fixed a test that validated a single transaction to actually work
with multiple autonested transactions applied.

Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Change-Id: Ia152b3ff385d2aa0cf40664ef039265b046b1d17

commit_message:
Add framework for doc building in ironic-lib

This adds a doc build for ironic-lib. Currently the only documentation
is that generated from docstrings.

Change-Id: I6ee00ad863bc7ce72958db4e8d5b6871a5b96eb0
Partial-bug: #1614272
